subject: Amendment to the provisions of Contract/ Concession Agreements pertaining to the constitution of Dispute Resolution Board (DRB) -reg.
text: HRay 75y @THNf gfeabru (Tss 4Rde7 &r TTAFf TART4, #RG TRTR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) T -a 6il-5 & 6, #ar7-10, ERAT, #f @eclt 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 T/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI Policy Guidelines/ Dispute Resolution & Legal Matters/ 2025 Policy Circular No. 2.1.83/2025 dated 02nd 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/DRB/2OZO (Comp. No.3033)} Sub: Amendment to the provisions of Contract/ Concession Agreements pertaining to the constitution of Dispute Resolution Board (DRB) -reg: Vide Policy Guidelines No: 2.1.37/2020 dated 16.03.2020 & Corrigendum No. 2.1.38 / 2020 dated 13.05.2020, it was directed to adopt the procedure of Dispute Resolution Board (DRB) in all ongoing PPP /HAM/EPC/Item Rate Projects. 2_ Articles 26.1.3 and 24.1.3 of the Standard Agreements for EPC and PBMC respectively contain provisions related to Dispute Resolution as under: "Failing mediation by the Independent Engineer or without the intervention of the Independent Engineer , either Party may require such Dispute to be referred to the Dispute Resolution Board ("DRB ) in accordance with the procedure set forth in Schedule-{**} to the Contract Agreement 3 It has been observed that for Projects where Project Cost put to Tender is <300 Cr (Rupees Three Hundred Crore) or constituting Dispute Resolution Board is not feasible in Engineering; Procurement and Construction (EPC) Contracts, Performance-Based Maintenance Contracts (PBMC) and Item Rate Contracts: 4 Accordingly, while using EPC/ PBMC/ Item Rate Contracts for {300 Cr below works, the Dispute Resolution Clause be deleted (relating to the Projects approved within NHAI). 5_ To implement the above amendment in Ongoing Contracts for below <300 Cr (Cost put to Tender) works where such work was approved within NHAI, the concerned Technical Division/RO as applicable shall enter into a Supplementary Agreement with the Contractor after getting the approval of the concerned Member to delete DRB provision if exists in such Contract. 6 This issue with the approval of Competent Authority. 51 's28 (CS.
